chargeHist.descr: Instigation of Animal Fights - Maintain Place For Dog Fight

result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Lavell Hazlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Instigation of Animal Fights-Spectator, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.08(3).
  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, assessments by the end of probation period ordered in Counts 9 and 10. Any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment.

Consecutive to: To each count and with other time being served, with credit for 14 days on Count 7. Good time allowed. No electronic monitoring allowed. This sentence is STAYED until 12-17-14, 5pm. Defendant instructed to report to the House of Correction. Huber release for employment and treatment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To each count and with any other time being served. no good time or electronic monitoring allowed. STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Defense disputes requested restitution amount. Hearing date scheduled for January 6, 2015.
***01-30-2015, Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $6,426.90 payable to Milwaukee Area Domestic Animal Control Commission by the end of probation period. Any balance remaining convert to civil judgment. The Court orders $1,250.00 of bail applied towards restitution; balance returned to remitter.

Pay all supervision fees.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, and assessments by the end of probation period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.

No illegal drugs or association with drug community (drug users/dealers/or drug houses).
No new law violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
No new ownership/possession of any dogs for 5 years.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
The Court orders the release of the dogs.
Defendant advised he is to continue with Justice Point supervision until his report date of 12-17-14.

Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary, successfully complete follow-up treatment.
Participate in random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: To each count and with any other time being served. No good time or electronic monitoring allowed.
STRAIGHT TIME.

records.addlTxt: Court signed Order Extending Probation. Copies disbursed.

Defendant Travis Lavell Hazlett in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Adrienne Brown for the Department of Correction.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
DOC requesting extension of probation due to lack of payment of restitution. Arguments heard. Court GRANTS DOC's request. Defendant's probation is extended for an additional 2 years.

records.addlTxt: Bail Packet Refund.

Restitution Notice/Affidavit mailed to victim on 02/10/15 DZ
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 02/10/15 DZ

Defendant Travis Lavell Hazlett in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Travis Lavell Hazlett in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Restitution hearing.  Hearing proceeded.  The parties have reached a stipulated resolution as to restitution amount.  Based upon agreement of the parties the Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $6,426.90 payable to Milwaukee Area Domestic Animal Control Commission by the end of probation period.  Any balance remaining to convert to civil judgment.  Defense motion to return bail to remitter heard; state objects.  The Court orders $1,250.00 of bail applied towards restitution; balance returned to remitter.

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Travis Lavell Hazlett not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Restitution Hearing.  Attorney Daryl Kastenson appears as successor counsel as Attorney Richard Johnson has retired from the public defender's office.  Defense needs time to prepare for this matter.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travis Lavell Hazlett in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State.  Due to the lateness of the hour (12pm) case passed until 1:30 p.m.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Travis Lavell Hazlett in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 7-10:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  

AS TO COUNTS 1-6:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court ordered Counts 1-6 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Counts 7-10.  

Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

CASE RECALLED......
